Key Match Events: The regular season finale between the Guardians and Houston Astros was canceled after a lengthy delay due to rain.
Cleveland third baseman José Ramírez was prevented from a shot at hitting his 40th home run and joining the exclusive 40-40 club.
Ramírez finished with 39 homers, leaving him one short of becoming the seventh player in MLB history to hit 40 homers and steal 40 bases in the same season.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt expressed concerns over player safety due to the field conditions.
Vogt reflected on José Ramírez's remarkable season despite missing the 40-40 milestone by one home run.
Vogt highlighted the Guardians' significant improvement in standings and attendance compared to the previous season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was called following a 3-hour, 5-minute delay due to continuous rain.
The Guardians finished the season at 92-69 and will host Game 1 of the ALDS on Oct. 5.
The Astros, with a record of 88-73, are set to open their AL wild-card series at home on Tuesday.
Astros' LF Yordan Alvarez is scheduled to take batting practice on Monday as he recovers from a knee sprain.
Guardians' RHP Alex Cobb is preparing to pitch in the postseason after recovering from a middle finger blister.
